definition: to carve/carved words/to agree/a contract/a deed
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy

sentences.english: The solicitor sent an extract of the deeds.
sentences.chinese: 初級律師寄出一份契據的摘錄本。

sentences.english: The Guarantor will only be responsible for its obligations under the guarantee and the guarantee claims deed.
sentences.chinese: 保證人僅對保證以及保證索賠契據下的義務負責。

sentences.english: Drag-and-drop, escrow and multiple recipient functions are supported.
sentences.chinese: 拖放，等待條件完成的契據和倍數收件人功能被支持。

sentences.english: Tom: So illiquid mortgage papers become "toxic assets" to the bank?
sentences.chinese: 非流動性契據就成了銀行的“有毒資產”？

sentences.english: They handle and format legal correspondence such as deeds, wills, affidavits and briefs.
sentences.chinese: 他們處理法律文件如契據，遺囑，證詞和簡報。

sentences.english: Tom: So, mortgage paper itself is an asset?
sentences.chinese: 那麼房屋抵押契據本身就是一種資產嗎？

sentences.english: A bond is a formal deed.
A deed whereby ownership of the property is transferred.
sentences.chinese: 財產所有權已被轉讓的契據。

definition: to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
debt security/collateralized debt obligation (CDO), type of bond
to bear joint responsibility for sth/joint liability (law)
